trans-unit.source: Appendix: Installing Apache Qpid Proton-C on an Azure Linux VM
trans-unit.target: Appendix: Installing Apache Qpid Proton-C on an Azure Linux VM

trans-unit.source: This section shows how to create a CentOS Linux VM using Azure Virtual Machines and how to download, build and install the Apache Qpid Proton-C library along with the Python and PHP language bindings.
trans-unit.target: This section shows how to create a CentOS Linux VM using Azure Virtual Machines and how to download, build and install the Apache Qpid Proton-C library along with the Python and PHP language bindings.

trans-unit.source: After completing the steps outlined below, you will be able to run the Python and PHP samples included with this developer’s guide.
trans-unit.target: After completing the steps outlined below, you will be able to run the Python and PHP samples included with this developer’s guide.

trans-unit.source: The first step is performed using the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://manage.windowsazure.com</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The first step is performed using the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://manage.windowsazure.com</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows how a CentOS VM named “scott-centos” is created:
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows how a CentOS VM named “scott-centos” is created:

trans-unit.source: After provisioning the portal displays the following:
trans-unit.target: After provisioning the portal displays the following:

trans-unit.source: In order to log on to the computer, you must know the endpoint port for SSH.
trans-unit.target: In order to log on to the computer, you must know the endpoint port for SSH.

trans-unit.source: You can obtain this value from the portal by selecting the newly created VM and clicking on the <ui>Endpoints</ui> tab.
trans-unit.target: You can obtain this value from the portal by selecting the newly created VM and clicking on the <ui>Endpoints</ui> tab.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows that the public SSH port for this computer is 57146.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows that the public SSH port for this computer is 57146.

trans-unit.source: You can now connect to the computer using SSH.
trans-unit.target: You can now connect to the computer using SSH.

trans-unit.source: This example uses the PuTTY tool, as in the following screenshot:
trans-unit.target: This example uses the PuTTY tool, as in the following screenshot:

trans-unit.source: For the Python and PHP apps, this example uses the Proton client libraries from Apache.
trans-unit.target: For the Python and PHP apps, this example uses the Proton client libraries from Apache.

trans-unit.source: These libraries are available for download from <externalLink><linkText>http://qpid.apache.org/download.html</linkText><linkUri>http://qpid.apache.org/download.html</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: These libraries are available for download from <externalLink><linkText>http://qpid.apache.org/download.html</linkText><linkUri>http://qpid.apache.org/download.html</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The Readme file in the distribution package explains the steps required to install the dependencies and build Proton.
trans-unit.target: The Readme file in the distribution package explains the steps required to install the dependencies and build Proton.

trans-unit.source: Here’s a summary of the steps:
trans-unit.target: Here’s a summary of the steps:

trans-unit.source: Edit the yum config file (/etc/yum.conf) and comment out the exclusion for updates to kernel headers (# exclude=kernel*).
trans-unit.target: Edit the yum config file (/etc/yum.conf) and comment out the exclusion for updates to kernel headers (# exclude=kernel*).

trans-unit.source: This is necessary to install the gcc compiler.
trans-unit.target: This is necessary to install the gcc compiler.

trans-unit.source: Install the prerequisite packages:
trans-unit.target: Install the prerequisite packages:

trans-unit.source: Download the Proton library:
trans-unit.target: Download the Proton library:

trans-unit.source: Extract the Proton code from the distribution archive:
trans-unit.target: Extract the Proton code from the distribution archive:

trans-unit.source: Build and install the code using the following steps, taken from the Readme file:
trans-unit.target: Build and install the code using the following steps, taken from the Readme file:

trans-unit.source: After performing these steps, Proton is installed on the computer and ready for use.
trans-unit.target: After performing these steps, Proton is installed on the computer and ready for use.
